newsitem.title: UK: LIFFE grains up amid new crop worries, USDA data.
newsitem.headline: LIFFE grains up amid new crop worries, USDA data.

text.p: LIFFE grains firmed but ended off highs, with new crop occupying the spotlight.
Talk of dry conditions in the UK and Spain, and their possible adverse effect on developing crops, pushed new crop contracts up, and the old crop was pulled along behind, traders said.
Traders' reaction to weekend data from the USDA, along with rises in U.S. grain and soy markets helped, traders said.
For once sterling's performance was ignored, they said.
There were some doubts as to whether London could sustain the rise. "Maybe it is a little overdone," one trader said. "There's no real news.
November was the most active month on wheat, with 274 lots changing hands. It last traded 1.50 stg higher, at 100.75, having seen a high of 101.00 stg.
November dominated barley, with 68 of a total 73 lots traded. It last traded 1.25 stg higher at 97.50 stg.
